Replace.Text: Allen M. Sumner

As the most advanced destroyer of its time, Allen M. Sumner, you and your sisters had the main gun power and anti-aircraft firepower of a Fletcher-class destroyer. Served in the hellish Battle of Okinawa, faced the suicide plane attack from Sakura Empire, your experience is varied and colorful. Allen M. Sumner, Believe you can lead Eagle Union to new glory!
Whoa! Hel-looo! The couch is all yours if you want it.
Unlike other Eagle Union leaders, Allen M. Sumner's Eagle Union will also be a cultural powerhouse.

Eagle Union is known for its industrial and technological prowess, and Allen M. Sumner is going to change that perception. The compact construction of the city will bring a large amount of [ICON_Culture] Culture to Allen M. Sumner, all in the service of a Cultural Victory: after researching the technology of "Flight", the [ICON_Culture] Culture output of the districts of Allen M. Sumner will provide an equal amount of [ICON_Tourism] Tourism. In modern times, cities with theater plazas will become world-famous tourist destinations. If you're looking for a Cultural Victory, Allen M. Sumner is sure to be a headache for you.

The USS Allen M. Sumner DD-692, was the first of the Allen M. Sumner class of destroyers built by the U.S. Navy during World War II -- shortened by the middle name Allen Sumner for common use. Captain Alan Melancson Sumner, Jr., who was about 26 years old when he was temporarily in command of a regiment and a wing at Verdun during World War I.
As the first ship, Allen Sumner was the first to begin construction on 7 July 1943 at the Federal Shipyard in Kearney County, New Jersey.
Bang for Your Buck
Willing to open up boundaries and pursue [ICON_Tourism] tourism performance. Like civilizations with high [ICON_Culture] cultural values and dislike civilizations that launch surprise wars.
Allen M. Sumner likes civilizations with higher Culture
(You have a high Culture)
Allen M. Sumner dislikes the civilization that announces surprise wars
(You declared a surprise war)
Shooting Gun-Star

All Districts +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture from each adjacent Districts. After Flight is researched, all districts receive [ICON_Tourism] Tourism equal to the [ICON_Culture] Culture output. +100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism pressure from the city with Theater Square towards other civilizations when the game enters the Modern era. Gain the Allen M. Sumner-class Destroyer unique unit when the Combined Arms technology is researched.
+{1_num} [ICON_Culture] Culture from each adjacent Districts.
Allen M. Sumner-class Destroyer

Allen M. Sumner's unique Atomic era naval unit that replaces the Destroyer. Stronger than the Destroyer, and has strong anti-air power, can carry out a range of 1 long range attack. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting a naval Raider, shows the naval raider in sight.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting Navy Raiders

The Allen M. Sumner class destroyer, or simply "Sumner class", was a class of destroyers built by the United States Navy between 1943 and 1946, with 58 ships built. As a result of the defeat at the Battle of Midway in 1942, the Japanese gave up their strategic attack and lost the right to control the sea and the air at the beginning of the war, while the confrontation between the two sides at sea and in the air became more and more intense. In such a background, the U.S. Navy believes that the Fletcher-class destroyer's anti-aircraft firepower needs to be further upgraded. So on the basis of the Fletcher-class destroyer hull, modify the superstructure and weapons configuration, the U.S. Navy designed a new generation of destroyers.

Construction of the first ship, the destroyer Allen M. Sumner, began at Federal Shipyards on July 7, 1943, with the remaining 57 ships of the same class following in a sequence of DD-692 through DD-709, DD-722 through DD-734, DD-741 through DD-748, DD-752 through DD-762, DD-770, and DD-774 through DD-781, DD-857.The Sumner class destroyers were originally planned to be built in 70 units, but 12 were later converted to fast minelayers, the Robert H. Smith class, during construction. Most of these Sumner-class destroyers entered service between 1944-1945, with three not completed for service until the end of World War II. The Sumner class destroyers built during World War II can be divided into two types, the early type and the late type, of which there were 26 ships of the early type, mainly with open bridges, and 29 ships of the late type, mainly with closed bridges.

In terms of powertrain, the Sumner class destroyers were similar to the Fletcher class destroyers in that they were fitted with the same four oil-fired boilers, two steam turbines, and produced the same 60,000 hp. However, due to the increased displacement, the maximum speed was reduced to 34 knots from 37.8 knots of the Fletcher class. In terms of weaponry, the Sumner class destroyer had three twin 127mm/38 Mk38 anti-aircraft guns in a turret arrangement with two forward and one aft, guided by the Mk37 fire control system and the Mk25 fire control radar for long-range air defense. At the same time, she also has 12 40mm Bofors anti-aircraft guns and 11 20mm Erlikon anti-aircraft guns to form a powerful anti-aircraft firepower. Initial design, the Sumner class also has two five 533mm torpedo tubes located in the chimney before and after the axis, and in the transom of the ship installed two deep bomb launchers and six K-type deep bomb thrower, to enhance its anti-submarine warfare capability, but with the Japanese attack in 1945 more and more inclined to suicide air raids, they also removed the rear torpedo tubes, replaced by a quad 40mm Bofors Bofors anti-aircraft gun. Compared to the predecessor Fletcher destroyers, the Sumner class destroyers had 20% more main gun firepower and 50% more anti-aircraft firepower. Due to the significant increase in anti-aircraft firepower, the Sumner class destroyers were often used as outer fleet anti-aircraft guard ships.
Haha, we'll be friends now!
Okay, but it's not possible right now~
Come on, let's declare friendship!
Hey hey~Not bad!
Well, that's it then.
Lol lol, looks like it's necessary to clear your head! I'll post another star afterwards~
Allow me to write to you: Eagle Union, now officially declares war on you!
Is it a delegation? I'll give them a good reception! They will marvel at the technological advances of Eagle Union.
Well, here's the thing: Eagle Union is not interested in your delegation right now.
Eagle Union has sent a delegation: we hope to establish deeper communication with your civilization.
Maybe it's because you're in a bad mood, or maybe you're just overwhelmed by impulse. But that's not good, is it?
Others in the Eagle Union have asked me to tell you: they can no longer stand what you are doing! (Condemn you)

Eagle Union's new destroyer, the Allen Sumner is me oh my! The Allen Sumner class is an improved version of the Fletcher class. Although we were outnumbered by them, we had better firepower and air defense! We were the strongest destroyer of Eagle Union at that time!
Hey, hey, wanna come visit a city near us?
Yikes, what a surprise. Let me enjoy your city then!
Heck, I'll introduce you to the great capital of the Eagle Union! Then it's your turn to introduce us to your capital!
Just call me Allen, please give me more guidance~
Hey, do you mind if I stick a new sticker for you?
How can we say that declaring war like this is not good?
It's time to form an alliance! Quick Alliance~Quick Alliance~Quick Alliance~
Eagle Union is willing to conclude peace between us.
That's not possible, our war is not over yet!
Come on! Let's lay down our weapons and stick "peace" stickers between the two countries!
Mmm, let me stick a "border access" sticker
Hmm... I don't have any more "border access" stickers now!
Eagle Union would like troops to pass through your borders. I hope you will grant permission.
Wow, what a hilarious border! Sadly, this kind of hilarity is not to everyone's liking: please remove the troops from Eagle Union border!
It's hard to march here... to evacuate casually? That wouldn't do!
Eagle Union troops will soon withdraw! No need to worry!
Relaxed too much ah...
Allow me to decline.
Well, a great deal!
